page.title: 03Fire Station
page.content: {Lyndhurst Fire Station.}The fire station has been on the same site, opposite Lyndhurst Park Hotel since 1947 and it was rebuilt in 1976.{It {has been a day manning station since {it was built in 1947.}It is manned by 12 wholetime and 12 part time firemen on a 24 hour rota basis.{The call out {system has changed from a siren to a {computerized teleprinter and bleeper {system from a central control at {Eastleigh.}Fire appliances at the station consist of 2 major pumps, 1 rescue tender, 1 water carrier and a landrover with pump.{The average {number of calls per year is 200 and {these range from cows in ditches to a {major fire at Esso Fawley Refinery. Calls in this area include a number of heath and forest fires as well as animal and car accidents.{There is no {ambulance in Lyndhurst. }
